# Jsonrpc

## JSON-RPC Attributes

This document defines attributes for JSON-RPC.

| Attribute | Type | Description | Examples | Stability |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| <a id="jsonrpc-error-code" href="#jsonrpc-error-code">`jsonrpc.error_code`</a> | int | `error.code` property of response if it is an error response. | `-32700`; `100` | ![Experimental](https://img.shields.io/badge/-experimental-blue) |
| <a id="jsonrpc-error-message" href="#jsonrpc-error-message">`jsonrpc.error_message`</a> | string | `error.message` property of response if it is an error response. | `Parse error`; `User already exists` | ![Experimental](https://img.shields.io/badge/-experimental-blue) |
| <a id="jsonrpc-request-id" href="#jsonrpc-request-id">`jsonrpc.request_id`</a> | string | `id` property of request or response. Since protocol allows id to be int, string, `null` or missing (for notifications), value is expected to be cast to string for simplicity. Use empty string in case of `null` value. Omit entirely if this is a notification. | `10`; `request-7`; `` | ![Experimental](https://img.shields.io/badge/-experimental-blue) |
| <a id="jsonrpc-version" href="#jsonrpc-version">`jsonrpc.version`</a> | string | Protocol version as in `jsonrpc` property of request/response. Since JSON-RPC 1.0 doesn't specify this, the value can be omitted. | `2.0`; `1.0` | ![Experimental](https://img.shields.io/badge/-experimental-blue) |
